intro: Coleataenia longifolia subsp. elongata, commonly known as the elongated leaf coleataenia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
